text:
Hey everybody - running into an odd problem here with HubDB and a listing page using URL parameters and a filter button.

I’m using request.dict to load rows based on the url parameter, everything is working, except one value with an & ampersand. I looked up and saw that ‘%26’ should be used in the url instead of ampersand, however, that’s not working to pull the info in for that value/topic. I really just need to figure out what formatting the URL needs in order to pull in that topic. All other filter values and options are working, just this one giving me a problem because of the ampersand. I’ve tried a couple things…

<https://get-vitalsource-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/resources/insights?topic=Course+Material+Access%26Affordability>
<https://get-vitalsource-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/resources/insights?topic=Course+Material+Access+%26+Affordability>

Thanks in advance for any help.
<@UBT0AHWLD> yes, that’s actually in one of the links I have there, the HubDB request.dict does not read it accordingly for some reason

In case you missed it - *TOMORROW is HubSpot.Extend(), our flagship conference for developers!!*

If you’re building, customizing, integrating, and developing on HubSpot the HubSpot.Extend() conference is for you—streaming right into whatever space you call your office!

Attendees will learn new techniques and tips in bite-sized workshops, dig into technical topics during breakout sessions from product and community experts, and enjoy plenty of opportunities to connect with like-minded developers around the world. Plus, we’ll have exciting announcements during the keynote you won’t want to miss.

Starts tomorrow at 9 AM Eastern, don't miss it!

Join us to talk more about it with your fellow attendees in <#CCGU4R4ER|extend>!
